comments.body: Moved some tests to large -- reduces test time by about 3 minutes (~9 to ~6). Actually, `test_expected_tags_logged_when_using_conda` didn't work in this runner -- wanted to avoid debugging that for now.
Putting the old logic into a for-loop (diff becomes smaller if you hide whitespace changes e.g. by viewing https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/2067/files?utf8=%E2%9C%93&diff=unified&w=1)
Hm, this is a good point, do we need to document that `mlflow models serve` doesn't yet work on Windows? Would the path to Windows support be to introduce e.g. waitress or some other web server here?
From offline discussion, sounds like we can add Windows support in the future
As we discussed offline, we've never officially supported windows. The current level of support for windows only covers tracking.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +122,126 @@def test_serve_gunicorn_opts(iris_data, sk_model):
    if sys.platform == "win32":
        pytest.skip("This test requires gunicorn which is not available on windows.")
    with mlflow.start_run() as active_run:
        mlflow.sklearn.log_model(sk_model, "model")

comments.body: Speaking of, should install_mlflow throw if it's true but no_conda is true?

Maybe. It could be a little annoying though - e.g. switching from conda to no conda right now requires changing only one argument on the command line, you might need to change two. 

I can add a test and throw an exception if you think it's safer / better?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@
# NB: need to install mlflow since the pip version does not have mlflow models cli.
install_mlflow = ["--install-mlflow"] if not no_conda else []

extra_options = no_conda + install_mlflow
